intro: Apodytes emirnensis, commonly known as the Persian sandthorn, is a shrub native to arid regions of Iran and Turkey. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny stems. The plant has adapted to harsh, dry environments with its deep root system and reduced leaf surface. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and contain a high concentration of nutrients. Due to its resilience, it is often used in ecological restoration projects in degraded landscapes.
